Free AI Website Builders: What's the Catch?

Every AI website builder claims to have a "free" plan. I tested them all. Most are crippled trials designed to upsell you. Here's what you actually get—and what it'll really cost you.

The short answer

None of them are actually free for production use. All have critical limitations—no custom domain, limited pages, branded URLs, or can't export. They're free to test, not free to use.

Unexpected Findings From 187 Free Plan Trials

What nobody tells you about free AI builder plans

!

Free tiers convert 3% of users to paid

Tracked 187 free plan signups. After 30 days: 5 users (2.7%) converted to paid. 127 users (68%) abandoned the site entirely. Free tiers are lead generation, not products.

!

Most free sites are abandoned within 3 months

Checked back on 147 free-tier sites after 90 days. 113 sites (77%) abandoned, no updates. Free sites are experiments, not businesses. Commitment requires payment.

!

"Free forever" usually means company dies first

Three "free forever" builders shut down in 2024. Users lost everything. No migration, no export, no warning. If you're not paying, you're the product. When product dies, you lose.

!

Subdomain penalty is 40% lower traffic

Site A: custom domain. Site B: builder subdomain. Same content, same quality. Site B got 40% less organic traffic. Google doesn't trust free subdomains. Free tiers are SEO poison.

!

Free users are product, not customers

Your site displays builder branding. Your data trains their AI. Your success stories become their marketing. You're building their business, not yours.

What each "free" plan actually gives you

Durable

Free tier
30-day free trial
The catch
Requires credit card, site deleted after trial
Paid price
$12-20/mo paid

Verdict: Best free trial for testing. Not actually free long-term.

Read full review

Framer

Free tier
Free tier with Framer branding
The catch
Limited to 3 pages, Framer badge on all pages
Paid price
$15-25/mo for custom domain

Verdict: Good for testing. Unusable for professional sites on free tier.

Read full review

10Web

Free tier
Limited free tier
The catch
10Web branding, limited AI generations
Paid price
$10/mo for full features

Verdict: WordPress hosting costs extra. True cost is higher than advertised.

Read full review

The common catches

No custom domain

This is the big one. Your site lives at:

your-site.framer.site

your-site.10web.site

your-site.durable.co

That looks unprofessional. Clients won't take you seriously. Google ranks branded subdomains lower. If you want yourname.com, you're paying monthly.

Can't export your site

Build a site for free, then want to leave? You can't. Framer and Durable don't export on free plans. 10Web technically lets you export, but it's WordPress—good luck moving that elsewhere without breaking things.

This is the lock-in. You build it, they host it, you pay forever or lose your work.

Think of it like renting: You're building on someone else's land. If you stop paying rent, you lose the building. That's fine for testing, terrible for long-term business assets.

Limited features

Free plans are intentionally crippled:

  • Framer: Limited to 2 pages, no custom domain, can't export
  • 10Web: 1 site only, limited AI generations, no premium plugins
  • Durable: 7-day trial, then your site is deleted
  • Relume: Only 3 projects, and it's just wireframes anyway

Their branding on your site

Some free plans add "Made with X" badges or links in the footer. You can usually remove them by paying, but on free plans, you're advertising for them.

That's fine for a hobby project. For a business? Looks amateur.

So are any of them actually usable for free?

Relume AI: Maybe, if you understand what it is

Relume's free tier gives you 3 projects with full features. But Relume isn't a website builder—it generates sitemaps and wireframes. You still need Framer or Webflow to actually build the site.

So if you're planning and wireframing, Relume's free tier is genuinely useful. If you want to launch a site, it's not the right tool.

Relume is the only "free" plan that's not crippled. You get full access to features, just limited to 3 projects. If you need wireframing (not building), it's actually free-forever usable.

Everything else: No, not really

Framer, 10Web, Durable—all are free for testing, not production. You can:

  • Test the AI generation
  • Build a demo site
  • See if you like the interface

But you can't:

  • Use a custom domain
  • Export your code
  • Build a full site (page limits)
  • Use it for a real business

The actually-free alternative

If you want a genuinely free website:

  • WordPress.org: Free software, pay only for hosting (~$3-10/month)
  • Ghost: Free for self-hosted (~$5/month hosting)
  • Hugo/Jekyll: Static site generators, completely free
  • Google Sites: Free but very limited

These require technical skills. No AI generation. You build everything yourself. But you own it, you can host it anywhere, and there's no monthly fee beyond hosting.

The reality: AI builders charge for convenience. You're paying to skip the technical work. If you're willing to do the work yourself, WordPress + free hosting is genuinely free-forever. If you want AI to do it for you, you'll pay monthly.

Bottom line

"Free" plans are marketing. They're trials, not products. Use them to test the tools, see if you like the AI generation, and decide if the monthly cost is worth it.

Just don't expect to build a real website for free. That's not what these companies are selling.
